alert.note: Alert for Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 1:09PM EDT until September 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following county, Richland. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 109 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Forest Acres, Dentsville, Arcadia Lakes, Killian, Woodfield, Sesquicentennial State Park, Villages at Sandhill, Lake Carolina, Columbia International University, Harbison State Forest, Blythewood, Cedar Creek Fire Station, Eau Claire and Upper Richland Fire Station. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 67 and 83. Interstate 77 between mile markers 11 and 28. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
